text: Hello, Is it possible to implement the login functionality in HubSpot? Like giving Login and sign up option to the user and then showing the data as per user? I am thinking about using hubdb table and then cross-checking user credential against it. But Please suggest am I thinking in the correct direction? Please respond if possible with example.
Not a good idea to store credentials in HubDB. You want to use Content Membership <https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/create-membership-content-using-marketing-hub>
Hey all, long time no chat! been on other projects but now trying to make some updates to the website.

Would like to implement a hubdb powered "press" section and for the most part, have everything working. the one piece I don't is pagination for when we get all that hawt press we can't contain it on one page. using the googler to find other examples of hubdb pagination techniques, but if ya'll have any tips I am all ears. thanks in advance!
this is what I have in place so far:
Thanks Matt, But I want website level login, not a page level. I want to implement login functionality for learning management system.

Matt, Do I need to follow this document <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cms-pages-editor/control-audience-access-to-pages?_ga=2.50586729.1945914156.1561795662-239009247.1549387897>
Matt,  what is your opinion about <https://w.inboundlabs.co/booya> ?
Matt, Meanwhile I have checked the article mentioned by you. It doesn't provide signup functionality. User has only Login option but not signup. Can you please help?
I want separate login and signup functionality for the website. Please guide me for that.

These may help - Check out these great HubDB entries by Katelyn in the (beta) Code Gallery:

 - <https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/katelynae-HubDB-Resource-Library?hsLang=en>

 - <https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/katelynae-HubDB-Event-Listing?hsLang=en>
